reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Quintessence is located at the outskirts of the village of Mont Tremblant right by the lake. There are only suites in this hotel, and they are quite a find: very spacious, well appointed, all with balcony to the lake. In addition, you find there a restaurant serving good breakfasts and excellent dinners. The clientele seems to be rather well-heeled considering the cars parking near the entrance of the hotel. There was only one experience that worsened the good impression. We wanted to have a nightcap in the bar but nobody was there to serve us besides a cook (Chef?) on a bar stool talking to customer and/or friend. But he failed to pay attention to us (e.g. calling a bartender) so we had to leave the bar without having a drink, that’s not the way we are used to be treated in an establishment like this. Apart from that, we enjoyed the stay in this fabulous place.
reviews.title: Chic hotel in the mountains with fine food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and it was simply fantastic ! We chose Clagett's Cabin. Very private, clean, great service although no room food service, simply because it is a walk away, then yet, you don't necessarily want to stay in the cabin all the time. Bath is great but not ideal since there is no shower curtain. The bathroom could be downsized really and a shower could be added. I just can't see going to the spa for a shower in winter. The staff is great and Julie and Sandrine at the Spa are real gems. Staff is more than helpful. We asked for ice, glasses, plates and they were more than willing to accomodate us. The surroundings are breathtaking and we will definitely go back and try the suites!
reviews.title: M a g n i f i c e n t!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 week at this wonderful hotel. Overall it is a great 5* hotel with all of the amenities you would expect and more.
reviews.title: An exquisite hotel

reviews.text: Pros

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The rooms are all ‘suites’. Actually, some of the rooms are suites i.e. separate living/bedrooms but not all. That said, our executive suite (Room 112) was one huge room with defined living/sleeping areas but no walls in between. It was simply gorgeous. Others have mentioned the log fires – incredible and romantic addition to the room. The furnishings are all good quality and the room and bathroom were very clean. Good view of the lake but also a rather good view of the car park. If this is going to bother you (it did not bother us) ask for a room in the middle of the hotel as all the end rooms share this view.
reviews.title: The best in Mont Tremblant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from a super-relaxing 2 night 3 days at quintessence. most has already been said in previous trip advisor reviews. 2 small glitches that should have been thought of before they happened. The first and most annoying was that since we were there at extremely low season was that they decided to clean hallway carpets on the floor above us...would not have been a huge issue but they decided to start this at 4AM!!!
reviews.title: spectacular location -- outstanding service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since this is only a 4-5 hour job they really should have started at a reasonable hour!! 2nd small glitch was that there is no real turn-down service such as you would expect at such a fine hotel, and the lady sent to deliver our evening chocolates on the 1st evening (we were out in mt tremblant village evening 2) reeked of cigarette smoke. This is however a 1st rate hotel with spectacular views rooms and service. Definitely worth a stay.
reviews.title: Attention to Detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is truly the perfect small boutique hotel! From the moment you arrive you are greeted by a warm staff that know your name(they memorize it) and make your stay unforgettable. The hotel was designed to cater everyone needs;standard rooms are enormous suites with large whirl tubs, wood burning fireplaces(they light it for you), balconies and amazing views of the lake.
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had the opportunity of staying one night in the Clagett Cabin. They most of flown the cabin in from some historic cozy town in the french alps because it is simply perfect. The pictures on the website cant compare to the warm and charming appeal. They go all out to make this cabin feel even more romantic....dim lighting controls, queen canopy bed,soothing music,claw foot bathtub, rustic beams, a fire place that has a "lifetime" supply of logs (located behind the cabin) and all the similar hotel amenities. The cabin is nestled high on an edge close to the lake capturing gorgeous views of Lake Tremblant. When night time falls, the cabin becomes an isolated retreat in the woods. You forget your just steps away from the hotel. The Clagett Cabin is a perfect retreat for a romantic getaway. Nothing can compare! If you want to impress someone this beats any ordinary hotel room.(would not recommend for a family or a long extensive stay)
reviews.title: Romantic Luxury Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can go on and on about "The Q" but the fact is "this is the best hotel in Mont Tremblant." The hotel focuses on the needs of the guest, you are not a room number but a valued customer with a name. The hotel is worth every penny and is in its own category high above its competitors (The Fairmont & The Westin).
reviews.title: Superb Hotel
Deservedly five star Quintessence
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights in September winding down after a fortnight touring Quebec. Whilst Mont Tremblant is a really nice place to stay, Quintessence is extra special because all rooms have a lakeview with balcony. Check in for us was extremely efficient and we were really pleased with our suite. Huge comfy bed, large soaker tub with nice toiletries. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Pierre

This is the only place to stay in Tremblant
reviews.text: I'm a female executive who often vacations alone so I want to indulge in the best. Hotel Quintessence was so elegant but in a country relaxed way. Gorgeous décor. breath-taking views. Impeccable service, perfection. I stayed a week and I can’t imagine staying anywhere else in Mt. Tremblant. It has 30 huge suites but it’s small enough that I was looked after personally, the staff addressed me by name and I felt very at home. Mont Tremblant is less glitzy and showy than Aspen or Vail and Quintessence is very exclusive and refined.

reviews.title: Highly Recommend!

The rooms were large, very clean, well appointed, great views. The concierge went out of their way to help us, and were proactive in working with us.

reviews.text: The hotel was comfortable. The staff extremely friendly and always smiling. The fireplace came with several logs (not just like many hotels where they only offer one log at a time). The view is beautiful and they have a boat available to their clients if you wish to explore the lake. Our stay came with the basic continental breakfast and one choice from the menu. reviews.title: Incredibly beautiful...but restaurant staff needs some fine tuning
reviews.text: However, for a 5 star hotel I was surprised to see that: some areas of the ceiling had been renovated but hadn't been repainted, the toilet paper was cheapest you can buy, the 5 star restaurant wasn't what we expected (my husband is a Cordon Bleu Chef and he was surprised to see veins in his foie gras, a big no no), the sommelier had a snobish attitude when we asked her questions, they didn't have underground parking.

reviews.title: A Small Piece of Paradise in Mont-Tremblant
reviews.text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. But compared to other condos in Tremblant, I'm not sure if this hotel was worth the extra $ for us.

reviews.title: Discreet elegance; the best of everything
reviews.text: Rooms - I had a 700 sq ft room with a king-sized bed, an open concept bathroom with a claw foot, remote controlled jacuzzi bathtub (amazing jets), a separate shower with a rain showerhead, separate room for toilet, Aveda products, a fireplace and sitting area, a balcony with the most incredible view of the lake. Plush huge towels, bathrobes, stocked bar, umbrella... they've thought of everything.

reviews.title: What a real nice place to stay

I didn't use the spa but had to enter it to get to the pool. There, you can also use the dry and wet sauna. As I was there for business, the meetings were held in the wine bar and this worked out well for our group of 30.

reviews.title: Even better the second time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only speak for this hotel and the Fairmont as we split our week between the two. The Quintessence was amazing. The hotel fully deserves it's reviews in all respects. If you are in anyway concerned that you will be away from the village and the lifts fear not, it's just a stones throw from the action whilst retaining a sense of peace and tranquility. It justifies it's billing as one of the great boutique hotels in the world. Of course it's pricey, but you get what you pay for, and you get it in spades. For family I'd go for the Fairmont as it's ski in ski out, with better hot pool facilities, and a bigger resort feel. For a couple looking for excellence, ambience and a pampered experience the Q is the property to go for. If I were to be picky, and I really hate to be in this case, I'd only say that the breakfast experience needs a review by the owners. It's fine, but just a little below par for a property of this outstanding class. That aside, the Q is an inspiration. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Excellence personified ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This past weekend Hotel Quintessence earned a place amongst our favorite hotels in the world. Hotels like the Park Plaza in New York, the Bilila Lodge Kempinski in the Serengeti and the Rarotonga Beach Bungalows in the Cook Islands.
reviews.title: Amongst our favorite hotels in the world.

reviews.title: Consistently a Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005
reviews.text: We just returned from our second annual stay at Quintessence, and cannot wait to visit again. The service at this hotel could not be better: enthusiastic, welcoming and helpful. The decor is beautiful and the rooms are spacious with wood burning fireplaces, beautiful views of the frozen lake, and supremely comfortable beds with that are hard to resist after a day's skiing. The bathrooms are a treat too: large free soaking tubs, walk- in showers with two shower heads, tons of towels and Avenda products. The food is the restaurant is excellent both for dinner and breakfast. In short, nothing has been overlooked at this small jewel of a hotel that succeeds in making both couples and families feel lucky to have found such a wonderful place.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
Romance, romance, romance!
reviews.text: This hotel truly exudes romance and low key luxury and sophistication. The attention to detail is outstanding. The best part of our visit to the Laurentians was hanging out in our beautiful room overlooking Lac Tremblant and luxuriating in all of it's wonderful amenities such as the wood burning fireplace, well appointed bathroom with spa tub and walk-in shower, and the feather bed that just enveloped us with warmth and comfort. Truly a memorable and special place.

reviews.title: Sheer delight
reviews.text: This is a very special hotel indeed. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the attention to detail is unsurpassed. The setting (right on the shores of Lac Tremblant) could not be better and it is close to the town without being crowded by it. I was not impressed by the restaurant where we felt the decor was a little glum and the service was a little slow (we waited 45 minutes between starter and main course) but these complaints only serve to show how marvellous the rest of the hotel really is. The staff were cordial and helpful without being pushy and the warm ambience of the place was really fabulous.

reviews.title: Five Star +++ Resort Hotel
reviews.text: One of the nicest hotels I ever stayed at. The rooms are very special and include a claw foot whirlpool tub, a wood burning fireplace, extra large size room equipped with a nice sound system, balcony with a view of the lake, and sitting area. The lobby does not seem like a hotel lobby, more like a large sitting room. no front desk like most hotels, just a desk with a hotel employee staffing it. The leather covered bannister leading to the wine celler bar and resturant was a nice touch.

reviews.title: This jewel of Mont Tremblant feels like a private club
reviews.text: The staff was very attentive and ready to please. Even if you do not stay at the hotel, visit the wine celler bar... it is special. The small size of the hotel makes it much more enjoyable. It almost feels like you are staying at someone's lakefront home. If you have a chance, stay here. It is worth the money. The hotel website does not do the hotel justice.

reviews.title: The Top Hotel/Resort in Tremblant
reviews.text: Surprisingly quiet on a warm week in the summer.

reviews.title: very Unique place in Tremblant
reviews.text: Surroundings: Located right on Lac Tremblant with spectucular views on the lake contrasted with the mountains. Resort was beautifully manicured. Right across the street from the larger Tremblant village, the resort is tranquil but accessible by foot to all the action.

reviews.title: Amazing experience at the Quintessence
reviews.text: Rooms: All rooms are suites with gorgeous bathrooms (oversized soaker tubs, heated floors, separate lavatory, great shower, double sinks, marble everywhere). Beautiful beds and living areas with fireplaces and balconies overlooking the lake. Very tasteful.

reviews.title: The Best Hotel I Have Ever Seen
reviews.text: Activities: Tremblant is a true four season resort. Great golf, hiking, biking, watersports, etc. in the summer and good skiing in winter (although a little cold).

reviews.title: Lakefront Luxury
reviews.text: Staff: Service was excellent and attentive but not over the top.

reviews.title: Perfect 10th Wedding Anniversary
reviews.text: Jan 4th to Jan 7th

reviews.title: Conde Nast's 'Most Excellent Small Hotel' for a reason
reviews.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary. We flew with Porter Airlines out of Toronto direct to Mont Tremblant where we were greeted by Steve our private driver for the hotel. He was a wealth of information and very helpful in every aspect. The Mont Tremblant Airport is actually a log cabin Chalet, truly beautiful.

reviews.title: Amazing Wedding Experience
reviews.text: We were greeted by the concierge at the hotel and quickly taken to our room where Steve showed us our amazing Q suite with fireplace, heated bathroom floors and awesome king size bed. This room took our breath away. Steve also lit the fireplace for us.

reviews.title: Great romantic getaway
reviews.text: The jacuzzi was heavenly after a day on the slopes, they have Avenda products for your use, we especially enjoyed the bath salts each day. The turn down service with chocolate mints was also a very special touch we looked forward to after our dinners each night.

reviews.title: Fantastic customer service and beautiful hotel - a great mix!
reviews.text: We ate at several restaurants, but our most memorable dinners were at La Forge and Coco Pazzo. Both outstanding in service. The Q's breakfasts were also something I looked forward to each morning. They serve a continental (pastries, cereals, fresh fruit) plus you get to pick one item off the menu - choices are extensive but we tried pancakes, french toast (my favorite), omelets and the croissant with scrambled eggs. We also enjoyed english breakfast tea and fresh juices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were looking for a luxurious respite - we found it at the Quintessence. The hotel website pictures are accurate, the hotel is beautifully appointed and maintained. The hotel itself fits within its rustic surroundings, while remaining luxurious and unpretentious. Perhaps because each unit is owner occupied/owned, but nothing is warn, the bed extremely comfortable, carpet and couch clean. It was as if the suite was turned over for its new owners - us. We stayed in a Q Suite on the 3rd floor. It was enormous and bright, vaulted ceilings making it feel more so. The room felt uncluttered, without feeling empty. The room was serene, and the bathroom more so. I ordinarily do not to use hotel bathtubs, however, this one could not be missed. I had the chance to see several other rooms (same class / lower floor, executive and Presidential) and I feel as if we received the best fit for us. The 3rd floor suites are naturally brighter. The views spectacular. While the executive and Presidential suites are most certainly beautiful, with added extras (aside from size) like small dining tables and outside hot tub (Presidential), we personally found the Q suite more intimate / precious (but not small at 700 sq ft). In other words, we found that we didn't miss a thing (to the contrary) while paying less (USD270/week night - AAA rate) and using the spa more. The spa is quite small, but adequate for a massage or a steam. However, if you're looking for a 'spa retreat' this isn't it. The staff was wonderful, addressing needs promptly. Service gaps certainly occur, however, they were handled professionally. The in-room breakfast menu was terrific, the lunch / dinner menu limited and could use expanding and creativity. We enjoyed our days out and about Mont Tremblant (especially the National forest), however, when we wanted to hide from the rest of humanity we couldn't have found a better place to hide in Mont Tremblant.
reviews.title: Luxurious Respite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful pure indulgence - go on treat your loved one! We were lucky to see the gorgeous colors of fall and enjoyed a fantastic game of golf just 3 minutes away at Le Geant. Wished we could have stayed longer. Worth every penny to live large!
reviews.title: unbridled luxury

likes.liked: — beautiful rooms in a gorgeous lakeside setting
likes.disliked: — the restaurant only served 3 course dinner but did accomodate our request

reviews.title: Beautiful property, Great staff
reviews.text: I had read some reviews of the Quintessence which implied that the staff wasn't totally "guest centered". This was not our experience at all--every staff person we interacted with was totally helpful, friendly and accomodating. The second day we had an issue with noisy yard work going on while we were eating breakfast outside. The issue was immediately and personally handled by the General Manager. Our sense was that the staff went out of their way to be responsive and it was impressive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is expensive, but also very beautiful and worth the splurge. The room we had was beautifully decorated and incredibly comfortable. I think this is an especially good property for a romantic getaway. The pool is smaller than it looks on their website and the pool area is very quiet. Although the staff is very nice to children, it is kind of a "quiet" place suited to adults rather than kids. I would have been uncomfortable taking small kids to the pool-- because I would have been very aware of disturbing the other guests. You enter the pool area through the spa--there is no other way to get there, which was kind of unusual and maybe set the tone for that kind of "spa quiet" experience in the pool area. Although we didn't try to order drinks at the pool or any kind of food service, it did not seem like the type of pool where you would want to sit around and have lunch or a drink. People I saw had bottled water only at the pool and many people there were obviously going to or coming from spa appointments.
reviews.title: Love the Q

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Even though the hotel was sold out when we were there, we had no sense of anything being crowded. The breakfast, which was included with our room was very good and we enjoyed eating outside on the beautiful terrace.
reviews.title: Quintessential - definately
